name: Lanikai Bed & Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Garden Studio at the Lanikai B&B from 6/2/09 through 6/7/09. This was our second visit to Oahu together: in 2006, we stayed in Waikiki and loved the powdery-soft beach at Lanikai. I definitely recommend staying at Lanikai rather than Waikiki for a relaxing vacation, and we would recommend this specific B&B. In particular, the garden studio was perfect: it was close to the beach, there was a cool breeze, it was comfortable, the gardens were pretty, the kitchen was well-stocked (to prepare your own meals), and Nini was very, very friendly. Nini and Rick provided backpack-style beach chairs, a cooler, boogie boards, and even a welcome Dole pineapple and muffins. There was even a binder of local restaurant menus which was helpful. We would definitely stay at the garden studio again.
reviews.title: Best Location for Lanikai Beach

reviews.text: We have just returned home after staying 10 nights in Oahu. This was our first trip to Hawaii, there were 5 people in our group. We spent 3 nights in Waikiki and had a great time there but were footworn and tired when we arrived at Lanikai Hale Mahina for 5 nights. We arrived to find a charming, comfortable and absolutely spotless home that contained everything we could need for our vacation. Clean, fluffy white towels, beach towels, beach matts, floaty toys, cooler for packing your lunch, a full sized fridge, spacious table for eating or playing games, screens on all the windows that can be left open day and night to allow the trade winds to blow - none of that relentless blowing of an air conditioner but plenty of fans to cool the rooms. Lanikai is a very short drive to Kailua town with all the shopping you need, try Don Quixote for groceries, Safeway, the Thursday evening market has plenty of veggies, fruit, flowers and plate dinners. Day trips to Honolulu and Waikiki are also an easy drive. I would absolutely recommend this accommodation to my family and friends. We also got a peek at the garden studio that is part of this same property, it has a private garden, beautifully decorated, again spotless, and is perfect for 2. Rick and his family were very welcoming, but not obtrusive. This accommodation is a licensed bed and breakfast and is a member in good standing with the Better Business Bureau, with no complaints when I checked before booking. Lanikai beach is beautiful day or night with the moon shining across the water, swimming is warm and safe. Do the hike up Lanikai ridge for the spectacular views. We will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Enjoyed a full moon at Hale Mahina

likes.liked: — The garden flowers, birds, provided everything we needed, clean and comfortable.

reviews.text: My family of 4 stayed here, and we felt very much at home. The breezes are incredible.
reviews.title: Lovely Place with Spirit of Aloha

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nini & Rick are great! Very warm and welcoming. Grizzly the dog was a wonderful stand in for my dogs.
reviews.title: Wouldn't go back

reviews.text: They even gave me a lovely lei for Mothers Day.
reviews.title: Nice, quiet getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the "Lanikai Garden Studio," which is attached to the owners' home on the first story of the property. Note: The "Lanikai Tree House" is the second story over the owners' home. All three lodgings share a long, wide driveway.
reviews.title: Nice stay - felt like a local

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: lovely secret quiet

reviews.text: - After studying prices of other Kailua beds and breakfasts, as well as Waikiki high rises, we felt that prices here were at least inline with the amenities provided and the location.
reviews.title: An enjoyable stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - A very well-stocked kitchenette helped us prepare simple breakfasts and lunches to keep down costs during our stay.
reviews.title: Happy Repeat Customer - Lanikai Garden Studio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - The private, hedge-screened back yard was a pleasant spot to enjoy a drink or meal.
reviews.title: Lovely, lovely, lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As the saying goes...location, location, location! Loved the location with multiple access points within a few minutes walk just across the street. Got up and watched the sunrise 3 of 4 mornings....just Gorgeous. We stayed in the garden studio and found everything to our liking. The unit is cosy and nicely furnished. Loved how most walls were louvered windows so you could adjust as you liked and get marvelous breezes,
reviews.title: Perfect studio in Paradise location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rick provided much info and recommended many places to shop and eat.
reviews.title: Beautiful!!
Lovely Lanikai
reviews.text: The main beach park down the road was the perfect beach for walks on the sand, dips in the ocean and just sitting in the shade listening to the waves ( made great use of the folding beach chairs and beach towels provided in the studio).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only thing I would change is the length of my stay!
reviews.title: Hands Down - The Best Accommodation in Kailua

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend and hope I get to visit again!
reviews.title: Aloha Spirit at it's finest

description: This home within a room is a place where you will be able to relax and feel totally at ease. With ample space and an abundance of windows and tropical flora views. All of this is accessed through the studio's private gated garden entry, and is just 100 yds. to Lanikai Beach.
